Instructions: Fill in as much of this questionnaire as you can and mail it to Saskatchewan Archives Office, Box 100, University of Saskatchewan, Saskatoon, Sask.

Name: Ruth L. Smith
Address: 203
Birthplace: Regina, Canada

1. LITHUANIAN IMMIGRATION
   What year did you start housekeeping in western Canada? 1915
   Where did you set up housekeeping? About 7 miles N.W. of Saskatoon
   Where had you been living before that? Canada, first with parents in 1910
   For how many people did you prepare meals? Two
   How far was it to your nearest store? 2 miles
   How often could a visit be made to the store? When our car could be spared
   What groceries did you usually buy in these earliest years?

2. FLOUR AND OTHER GRAIN PRODUCTS
   What brand of white flour did you use in the early years? Purely or Fine Rose
   In what quantities did you buy it? 98 lbs each
   What was the usual price per hundred pounds of white flour? Not sure around 3¢
   How much did you use graham flour?
   Whole wheat flour?
   Was flour milled locally? No, far away? That year?
   What was the price for a twenty pound bag of rolled oats? About 1¢
   What other grain products did you use?
   Cornmeal? Yes
   Whole wheat? Farina? Very little
   Other?
   Did you grind your own wheat for porridge? No
   How did you grind it?
4. What are your favorite activities?
   - I enjoy reading books and watching movies.
   - I also like to play sports and exercise regularly.

5. How do you manage stress?
   - I try to maintain a healthy diet and exercise regularly.
   - I also find it helpful to spend time with friends and family.

6. What are your career goals?
   - I aim to pursue a career in technology and innovation.
   - I am also interested in pursuing further education in the field of computer science.

7. How do you stay connected with others?
   - I use social media platforms to connect with friends and family.
   - I also attend events and gatherings to meet new people.

8. What are your hobbies?
   - I enjoy playing music and singing.
   - I also love traveling and exploring new places.

9. How do you handle conflicts?
   - I try to communicate openly and honestly with others.
   - I also seek to understand different perspectives and find common ground.

10. What are your aspirations for the future?
    - I hope to achieve success in my career and make a positive impact on society.
    - I also aspire to be a good role model for others and inspire them to pursue their dreams.

16. WRAPPINGS AND CONTAINERS

Mention any changes which you recall in the wrappings and containers received with the food you purchased (give dates where possible).

I don't remember when the change took place but now it's waxed paper or cello instead of early cheap brown paper.

17. Give a typical day's menu (breakfast, dinner & supper) for the earliest year you can remember. Give the year and list the members of the family with their ages at the time. State the approximate month, e.g., winter or summer.

Breakfast - Rolled oats, poached eggs, toast & jelly, tea.

Dinner - Baked potatoes, some vegetable, pork or beef, lemon or apple pie, perhaps a chocolate pudding, bread, butter, tea.

Supper - Bacon, eggs, warmed up potatoes, a light cake, some fruit, perhaps hot biscuits, bread & butter.

18. What year did you serve your first Christmas dinner in Western Canada? Give the menu. List those present and give their approximate ages at that time.
